# scm_url_category (Resource)

UrlCategory resource

## Example Usage

```terraform
#
# Creates a custom URL Category object.
#
resource "scm_url_category" "example" {
  folder      = "Shared"
  name        = "example_url_category"
  description = "Test URL Category for create API"
  list        = ["example.com", "test-create.com"]
  type        = "URL List"
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) Name

### Optional

- `description` (String) Description
- `device` (String) The device in which the resource is defined

> ℹ️ **Note:** You must specify exactly one of `device`, `folder`, and `snippet`.
- `folder` (String) The folder in which the resource is defined

> ℹ️ **Note:** You must specify exactly one of `device`, `folder`, and `snippet`.
- `list` (List of String) List
- `snippet` (String) The snippet in which the resource is defined

> ℹ️ **Note:** You must specify exactly one of `device`, `folder`, and `snippet`.
- `type` (String) Type

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) UUID of the resource
- `tfid` (String) The Terraform ID.


## Import

The following command can be used to import a resource not managed by Terraform:

```bash
terraform import scm_url_category.example folder:::id
```

or

```bash
terraform import scm_url_category.example :snippet::id
```

or

```bash
terraform import scm_url_category.example ::device:id
```

**Note:** Please provide just one of folder, snippet, or device for the import command.
